entries.title: Government Regards New COVID Testing Requirements on Chinese Travellers as Modest Measure
entries.description: A health worker wears protective gear as she gives a nucleic acid test to detect COVID-19 on a local resident at a mass testing site after new cases were found, on April 6, 2022 in Beijing, China. (Kevin Frayer/Getty Images)

entries.title: Kim Jong Un Orders New ICBM, Bigger Nuclear Arsenal Amid Tension
entries.description: North Korean leader leader Kim Jong Un attends the 12th Meeting of the Political Bureau of the 8th Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), in Pyongyang, North Korea, in this photo released on Dec. 31, 2022. (KCNA via Reuters)

entries.title: Australia to Require Negative COVID-19 Tests for Travelers From China
entries.description: Passengers from China arrive at Perth International Airport, Australia on Feb. 2, 2020. (Paul Kane/Getty Images)

entries.title: Doctors in China’s Countryside Face Wave of Infections With Scarce Medical Resources
entries.description: Patients wait to see the doctors at a fever clinic of Dongguan People's Hospital in Dongguan, Guangdong Province of China, on Dec. 20, 2022. (VCG/VCG via Getty Images)

entries.title: Rex Murphy: The Vagaries of Air Travel in Today’s Canada
entries.description: Passengers check in at Vancouver International Airport in Richmond, B.C., on Dec. 26, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

entries.title: National Association of Police Chiefs Calls for Bail Reform After Murder of Constable
entries.description: Members of the Ontario Provincial Police Orillia Detachment pay their respects as the hearse carrying Const. Grzegorz "Greg" Pierzchala arrives at the Duckworth exit in Barrie, Ontario, from Highway 400 on Dec. 30, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Christopher Drost)

entries.title: Arrest Made in Death of Réjean Hébert, Longtime Radio Journalist in New Brunswick
entries.description: The RCMP logo is seen outside the RCMP "E" Division Headquarters, in Surrey, B.C., in a file photo. (Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: Feds Eyeing ‘Variety of Options’ for Planned Firearm Buyback Program: Mendicino
entries.description: Minister of Public Safety Marco Mendicino speaks during question period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on Oct. 4, 2022. (Sean Kilpatrick/The Canadian Press)

entries.title: 9 Suffocate to Death in Ugandan New Year Firework Stampede: Police
entries.description: People cry and hold each other in Kampala, Uganda, on Jan. 1, 2023, following a New Year fireworks stampede, in a still from video. (NTV via Reuters/Screenshot via NTD)

entries.title: More Than 45,000 Illegal Immigrants Crossed English Channel to UK in 2022
entries.description: An inflatable craft carrying illegal immigrants crosses the shipping lane in the English Channel off the coast of Dover, England, on Aug. 4, 2022. (Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)

entries.title: Anthony Furey: A Rough Year Ahead for Justin Trudeau
entries.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks at the General Motors CAMI production plant in Ingersoll, Ont., on Dec. 5, 2022, when he and Ontario Premier Doug Ford launched Canada’s first full-scale electric vehicle manufacturing plant. (The Canadian Press/Nicole Osborne)

entries.title: Is There a Single Best Electoral System?
entries.description: A voter drops their ballot in a box at a polling station at Town Hall in Sydney on July 2, 2016. (AP Photo/Rick Rycroft)

entries.title: Lebanese and UN Troops Rescue Migrants Vessel, 2 Killed
entries.description: Lebanese army on their dinghy, rescue migrants from a boat sinking in the Mediterranean Sea, near the shores of Tripoli, north Lebanon, on Dec. 31, 2022. (Lebanese Army Website via AP)

entries.title: Champagne’s Rogers-Shaw Decision to Come ‘Only After’ There’s Clarity in Legal Battle
entries.description: The Rogers Communications Inc. sign at the company's headquarters in Toronto on April 25, 2012. (The Canadian Press/Aaron Vincent Elkaim)

entries.title: North Korea Launches 3 Ballistic Missiles Amid Tensions Over Violation of Airspace by Drones
entries.description: A TV screen shows a file image of North Korea's rocket with the test satellite during a news program at the Seoul Railway Station in Seoul, South Korea, on Dec. 31, 2022. (Lee Jin-man/AP Photo)

entries.title: Montreal Jail Manager Suspended After Death of Illegally-Detained 21-Year-Old Man
entries.description: People attend a vigil in memory of Nicous D'Andre Spring in Montreal, Dec. 30, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Graham Hughes)

entries.title: 15 Dead, 47 Injured in Western Mexico Bus Crash
entries.description: Police car lights. (Scott Rodgerson/Unsplash)

entries.title: Landslide Kills at Least 8 People in Eastern Congo
entries.description: (Google Maps/Screenshot via The Epoch Times)

entries.title: New Year Celebrations Around the World to Welcome 2023: Photos
entries.description: A spectator holds a smartphone as fireworks explode next to the Arc de Triomphe, at the Avenue des Champs-Elysees during New Year celebrations in Paris, early on Jan. 1, 2023. (Julien de Rosa/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Putin Gives New Year Address to Nation, Says 2022 Was Year of ‘Difficult but Necessary Decisions’
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin makes his annual New Year address to the nation at the headquarters of the Southern Military District in Rostov-on-Don, Russia, on Dec. 31, 2022. (Sputnik/Mikhail Klimentyev/Kremlin via Reuters)

entries.title: ‘Lofty Expectations’ for 17-Year-Old Hockey Phenom Connor Bedard
entries.description: Canada’s Connor Bedard chases the puck during second period IIHF World Junior Hockey Championship action against Austria, in Halifax on Dec. 29, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darren Calabrese)

entries.title: Canada to Require COVID-19 Testing for Travellers From China
entries.description: The Vancouver International Airport in Richmond, B.C., on Dec. 26, 2022. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)
